Swimming Pool Market Size 2024-2028

The swimming pool market size is forecast to increase by USD 7.44 billion, at a CAGR of 4.64% between 2023 and 2028. The increasing demand for luxurious lifestyles is driving the demand for amenities such as swimming pools, spa facilities, and other recreational water features in above ground swimming pools. The growing consumer interest in recreational water activities, such as swimming, water sports, and relaxation, is driving the popularity of these amenities and driving growth in the market. The growing popularity of saltwater pools, which offer benefits such as lower maintenance and a more natural swimming experience, is also contributing to market growth by increasing the demand for these types of pools.

Market Dynamics and Customer Landscape

The market is thriving with the focus on health and wellness and rising popularity of health and wellness centers that offer natural healing through traditional medication processes and leisure activities. These pools are constructed using various materials such as concrete, stone, metal, plastic, fiberglass, and polyurethane foam, catering to different preferences and budgets. From private pools in homes to luxury hotel rooftops with infinity pools, there is a growing trend towards integrating pools into outdoor living spaces. To ensure hygiene, water in these pools is filtrated, sanitized, and circulated, providing a safe environment for recreational and fitness activities. Our researchers analyzed the data with 2023 as the base year, along with the key drivers, trends, and challenges. A holistic analysis of drivers will help companies refine their marketing strategies to gain a competitive advantage.

Key Market Driver

One of the key factors driving the market is the growing popularity of saltwater pools. There is a growing preference for saltwater pools due to their reduced need for harsh chemical additives, providing a more comfortable and enjoyable swimming experience with milder water that is gentler on the skin, eyes, and swimwear. This trend aligns with the focus on wellness and fitness, as saltwater pools are often associated with natural healing and offer a more relaxing experience akin to traditional medication processes.

Additionally, they contribute to the creation of relaxation pools and enhance outdoor living spaces. Salt chlorinators, a key component of saltwater pools, help maintain consistent levels of chlorine automatically, reducing the need for frequent manual testing and chemical adjustments. As a result, saltwater pools require less hands-on maintenance and experience fewer fluctuations in water quality, driving their adoption in the market. Despite the higher initial investment of a salt chlorination system, the long-term cost savings compensate for this expense. These factors are positively impacting the market and are expected to drive its growth during the forecast period.

Major Market Trends

A key factor shaping the market is the high growth in the tourism industry. There is an increasing focus by tourist destinations such as resorts, luxury hotels, and vacation properties on providing top-notch amenities to attract travelers seeking relaxation and entertainment. Swimming pools, both indoor and outdoor, have become an essential feature of these accommodations, significantly contributing to the overall guest experience.

Moreover, there is a growing popularity of wellness tourism in the market, which is fuelling the demand. Furthermore, several travelers are constantly seeking destinations that offer opportunities for rejuvenation, exercise, and relaxation, which has encouraged hotels and resorts to heavily invest in expansive spa complexes that often include swimming pools as a primary component. Hence, such factors are expected to drive market growth during the forecast period.

Significant Market Challenge

High installation and maintenance costs are one of the key challenges hindering market growth. There is a high cost associated with the installation and maintenance costs. Some of the costs associated with swimming pools include regularly changing the water, cleaning the filters, and power consumption by motor pumps. Additionally, the skilled and trained individuals needed to operate swimming pool equipment is another significant cost factor.

Moreover, there is an increasing scarcity of water resources in several countries, such as Yemen, Libya, and Jordan, due to the ecological balance. Therefore, in such countries, the cost of water is extremely high. Therefore, the existing financial weakness and the high initial costs can negatively impact the market, which in turn will hinder the market growth during the forecast period.

Market Segmentation

The construction segment is estimated to witness significant growth during the forecast period. The construction segment comprises the planning, design, and physical construction of different types of swimming pools, catering to both residential and commercial customers. Several homeowners in the residential sector are constantly seeking to improve their property value and lifestyle by incorporating personalized designs into their outdoor spaces.

The construction segment was the largest segment and was valued at USD 17.80 billion in 2018. Construction in the residential sector comprises collaborating with homeowners to bring their visions to life, including everything from size and shape preferences to water features, lighting, and landscaping. On the other hand, construction in the commercial sector is fuelled by the demand in the hospitality, leisure, and wellness industries. The construction of a commercial pool encompasses meticulous planning to ensure safety compliance, durability, and adherence to brand aesthetics. Furthermore, there is an increase in demand for cutting-edge designs that offer not only entertainment but also unique experiences for visitors across water parks, theme parks, and public swimming complexes. Hence, such factors are expected to fuel the growth of this segment which in turn will drive the market growth during the forecast period.

North America is estimated to contribute 44% to the growth of the global market during the forecast period. Technavio’s analysts have elaborately explained the regional trends and drivers that shape the market during the forecast period. One of the main factors that is significantly contributing to the growth of the global in North America is the increasing demand from the residential sector. The demand for residential swimming pools is driven by several factors, including the desire for private recreational spaces, increased disposable income, and the preference for at-home leisure activities. Additionally, there is an increasing investment by several homeowners in the region in a variety of pool types, such as in-ground, above-ground, and semi-ground pools, to create personalized outdoor retreats. Innovative designs and flexible installation options are driving growth in the semi inground pool market, appealing to a broad range of consumers. Hence, such factors are expected to drive the market in the region during the forecast period.
